guicomponents
Class GKnobOval

java.lang.Object
  guicomponents.GComponent
      guicomponents.GRoundControl
          guicomponents.GKnob
              guicomponents.GKnobOval
All Implemented Interfaces:
GConstants, java.lang.Comparable<java.lang.Object>
public class GKnobOval
extends GKnob

The provides an extremely configurable GUI knob controller. GKnobOval inherits from GKnob which inherits from GRoundControl so you should read the documentation for those classes as it also applies to GKnobOval.

For circular knobs use GKnob rather than this class.
To avoid inaccuracies when drawing the bezel arcs it is recommended that the length of the major axis should not exceed 1.5 x the minor axis and/or the bezel width is kept small.

Configurable options
Knob height and width (should be oval)
Start and end of rotation arc.
Bezel width with tick marks

Documentation for the following can be found in GRoundControl
Range of values associated with rotating the knob
Rotation is controlled by mouse movement - 3 modes available
(a) angular - drag round knob center
(b) horizontal - drag left or right
(c) vertical - drag up or down
User can specify mouse sensitivity for modes (b) and (c) Use can specify level of inertia to give smoother rotation Note: Angles are measured clockwise starting in the positive x direction i.e. 

         270
          |
    180 --+-- 0
          |
          90

Author:
Peter Lager

Constructor Detail

GKnobOval

public GKnobOval(PApplet theApplet,
                 int x,
                 int y,
                 int width,
                 int height,
                 int arcStart,
                 int arcEnd)
Create a GKnobOval control

Will ensure that width and height are >= 20 pixels
The arcStart and arcEnd represent the limits of rotation expressed in degrees as shown above. For instance if you want a knob that rotates from 7 o'clock to 5 o'clock (via 12 o'clock) then arcStart = 120 and arcEnd = 60 degrees.

Parameters:
theApplet -
x - left position of knob
y - top position of knob
width - width of knob
height - height of knob (if different from width - oval knob)
arcStart - start of rotation arc (in degrees)
arcEnd - end of rotation arc (in degrees)
